io.github.thunderbots.lightning.control

Class Joystick

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.thunderbots.lightning.control.Joystick

  • public class Joystick
extends java.lang.Object
    A Joystick object represents one of the physical game controllers that are connected to the driver station.

    Due to a currently existant problem in the way that the control system handles the controllers, a new joystick object is contructed every hardware cycle. References to joysticks should not be kept for any reason. Instead, all joysticks should be accessed through Lightning.getJoystick(int)

    Author:
    Zach Ohara

      • THUMBSTICK_THRESHOLD

        public static final double THUMBSTICK_THRESHOLD
        The threshold that must be exceeded by the raw thumb stick values before it should register at all. The purpose of this value is to prevent random noise and false movements from being registered and acted upon.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • THUMBSTICK_MAX

        public static final double THUMBSTICK_MAX
        The maximum value that can be expected from the thumb stick values.
        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • scaleJoystickInput

        private static double scaleJoystickInput(double raw)
        Scales the given input value to a number between the rest position and the maximum position of the thumb stick, based on its relative position between the minimum and maximum positions. This allows the thumb sticks to show a smooth transition between the minimum and the maximum, even though any value less than the threshold will be reported as zero.

        This method acts as a delegate to MathUtil.scaleToRange(), but supplies the thumbstick constants as the range bounds.

        Parameters:
        raw - the raw input value from the joystick, between the threshold and maximum positions.
        Returns:
        the corresponding value between the minimum and maximum positions.
        See Also:
        MathUtil.scaleToRange(double, double[], double[])
